channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19: Pregnant women urged to get the jab after mum's death
item.description: A Northern Ireland doctor says hospitals are now "constantly" seeing pregnant women with Covid-19.

item.title: Dr Anne McCloskey investigated over vaccine comments
item.description: Officials are looking into comments by Dr Anne McCloskey that vaccines are "damaging" young people.

item.title: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson to run for Lagan Valley MLA seat
item.description: Sir Jeffrey will run against the man he replaced as party leader, Edwin Poots, in the 2022 election.

item.title: Northern Ireland rural broadband scheme gets £25m funding boost
item.description: Project Stratum will get an extra £25m to provide ultra-fast broadband to remote homes.

item.title: Afghanistan: Irish citizens wait for rescue mission
item.description: Troops and diplomats are assist more than 30 people who are struggling to get to Kabul airport.

item.title: Samantha Willis: Funeral of woman who died with Covid-19 after giving birth
item.description: Samantha Willis, who had Covid-19, died after giving birth to her fourth child.

item.title: High pressure driving dry weather in Northern Ireland
item.description: Dry weather is expected over the next seven days, with warm temperatures set to peak on Wednesday.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Ards swimmer Barry McClements will be first Irish hopeful in action
item.description: Ards swimmer Barry McClements will be the first member of Team Ireland in action at the Paralympics on Wednesday.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 12,000 vaccine doses given out at weekend
item.description: It comes as the health minister says the time is not right to re-impose tighter restrictions in NI.

item.title: Londonderry: Police defend response to shots fired at republican mural
item.description: The police say officers were in the area when shots were fired before a commemoration in Londonderry.

item.title: Union concern over chief nursing officer departure
item.description: Chartotte McArdle is moving to NHS England as deputy chief nursing officer for patient safety.

item.title: Ulster Rugby: 10,000 supporters can attend Kingspan for pre-season friendly against Saracens
item.description: Up to 10,000 home supporters will be able to attend Ulster's pre-season friendly against Saracens at the Kingspan Stadium on 3 September.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Race against time' to rescue interpreter's family
item.description: A naval officer says the family of a man he worked with in Afghanistan are under threat.

item.title: Covid-19: Nine more Covid-related deaths and 1,320 new cases
item.description: There are currently 352 patients with Covid-19 in Northern Ireland's hospitals, with 43 patients in ICU.

item.title: Covid-19: PCR test market needs 'cleaning out', says Randox boss
item.description: Peter Fitzgerald says some Covid-19 test firms may not be delivering the service they claim.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 8,000 first jabs given in weekend vaccine push
item.description: The total is still being counted and the exact number is expected to be announced on Monday.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Northern Ireland's summer surge figures make for grim reading
item.description: Northern Ireland now has the UK's highest death and infection rates and its lowest vaccination rate.

item.title: Covid-19: Thousands queue across NI for Big Jab Weekend
item.description: The campaign sees regional centres offering walk-in first jabs to the over-18s for the last time.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records highest number of cases in a single day
item.description: Another 2,397 cases are reported, as doctors warn hospital staff are struggling to meet demand.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Irish Sea tunnel vision - roadworthy or pipe dream?
item.description: A BBC documentary asks how serious is Boris Johnson about a link from Scotland to Northern Ireland?

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Dementia and the power of sporting memories
item.description: Recollections from the terraces or the pitch can be invaluable for sports fans with dementia.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'You fear for your family and friends at home'
item.description: Four people with links to the island of Ireland speak of their fears for relatives amid the chaos.

item.title: 'My sister's legacy is the Sibling Grief Club'
item.description: Sisters from County Tyrone started The Sibling Grief Club after their youngest sister died suddenly.

item.title: Magee Medical School: 'I am very excited to get started'
item.description: A former investment banker and an ex-political adviser are among the first students at a new medical school in Londonderry.

item.title: The NI inventor who saved thousands of lives
item.description: The plane ejector seat was invented by James Martin, from Crossgar in County Down, in 1944.

item.title: Transatlantic tale of message in a bottle washed up in County Kerry
item.description: From Canada to County Kerry, three Irish cousins find a message sent by a fisherman a year ago.

item.title: Sport 'very important' in living with dementia
item.description: Gerard Doran, 62, said involvement with hillwalking and GAA have benefited him physically and mentally.

item.title: Magee Medical School finally opens in Londonderry for 70 students
item.description: Funding problems delayed the opening at Ulster University's Magee campus in Londonderry.

item.title: Derry medical school 'a dream come true'
item.description: The first student doctors have started training at Londonderry's new medical school

item.title: Londonderry: Unionists condemn 'shots' near republican mural
item.description: The incident, in the Galliagh area of Derry, took place at a mural of hunger striker Michael Devine.

item.title: Premier Division: Candystripes edge out Sligo in Showgrounds derby
item.description: Ronan Boyce hits a late winner as Derry City defeat Sligo Rovers 2-1 in the north-west derby.

item.title: Irish Army Rangers go to Kabul to help evacuation
item.description: Foreign Minister Simon Coveney says the small team will assist in the evacuation of Irish citizens.

item.title: Galway M6 crash victims were Kurdish family
item.description: The family, which included an eight-month-old baby girl, had been living in Ireland since 2017.

item.title: Galway: Infant and parents among four dead in collision
item.description: Police say four people died at the scene of the three-vehicle collision on the M6.

item.title: Wally the walrus to get his own pontoon
item.description: It is hoped the floating platform will stop the walrus from sinking more boats.

item.title: Two men die in three-vehicle crash in County Meath
item.description: A man in his 40s and a man in his 30s die in a three-vehicle crash on the R152 at Keenogue.
